intro: Sphaeralcea ambigua, commonly known as the narrowleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes mallows and hibiscus. The plant produces showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of its branches. It has slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Sphaeralcea ambigua is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
